title: Communications Services Down As Streaming Wars Heat Up - Communications Services Roundup
text:
Communications services companies fell as the "streaming wars" heated up.

Walt Disney's new Disney+ streaming service impressed some viewers in a free trial in the Netherlands, The Wall Street Journal reported. The service is expected to be one of the strongest challengers to Netflix yet, and one of several in the works from major studios.

Comcast's NBCUniversal has consolidated its television-production unit under executive Bonnie Hammer and named a new head of its soon-to-be launched streaming service as part of a broad realignment of its entertainment operations, the company said Monday.

A top European Union privacy regulator, Ireland's Data Protection Commission, is moving closer to making draft decisions involving Facebook's WhatsApp and Twitter under the bloc's new privacy law, known as GPDR.
